reviews.text: An extremely beautiful museum with wonderful art exhibits.  The building is bright, open and beautiful.  Very interesting and unique art exhibits on display.

My wife and I went here on a rainy day during a little getaway in Durham. The traveling exhibit was about Pop art and it was OK. We thought it was interesting and presented well. My only problem was that the pieces that I found most interesting were those that didn't have a card explaining them, but that's just me.

The general collection is good, but it is pretty small. They have a good collection from the Americas. There are some interesting Roman pieces too. There is a really interesting photography exhibit from Hugh Mangum that we enjoyed. That's a recent addition to the general collection and it's worth seeing.

Why only 3 stars? As regular plebians (read: not Duke alumni) we had to pay $7/person to get in for what was barely an hour of looking around. I actually read every card on the wall and spent some time looking more seriously at a few pieces and we still barely spent an hour there. We also had to pay to park in the lot. I don't feel like it was a great value for what we saw and experienced.
It was our first visit there. I liked it a lot. It was crowded because of event, but we still liked it.
I have seen some truly amazing art at this great venue..it is also a amazing event venue located on the campus of Duke University....
Very cool space and nice exhibits. Staff was excellent.

What a great experience! While the center itself may be a bit awkward to find, my GPS was accurate. If you drive yourself, there is ample parking. Make sure you come property dressed for the weather. If it's raining, you might get wet and muddy. The tours were prompt and informative. Everyone that worked there was friendly and knowledgeable. They have a plethora of lemurs which is a true treat in North America! A definite must-stop if you're in the area.

My family had a wonderful time! The tour guide was knowledgeable and the tour was interesting.

Regarding some of the negative reviews:
This is not a zoo, it is a research facility that offers tours to the public.
Had a phenomenal experience. They make you feel at home, and most importantly it was fun!

After years of waiting, I finally got to see the lemurs. Totally worth the wait! The tour starts with a short informative video, then a walk to see some of the lemurs in their outdoor homes. It's a little tough to get a picture of them in the enclosures, but their cuteness is apparent even from far away. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable. By the end, you can't help but pick up a couple souvenirs to bring home (plus it supports the research efforts). Highly recommend!

What a fantastic facility with great access to the lemurs! During the summer they have open house weekends when the lemurs are viewable in enclosures and also indoors in the nocturnal house where those lemurs who are active at night are on a flipped schedule from our own. During the summer they don't offer first this where you can see the lemurs in the forest outside of the enclosures which I'm sure is fantastic.

Nice exhibits and very interesting film. Very friendly and informative staff. I knew about Appomattox but this place seems to be less famous. The actual building that Sherman and Johnston met is not the original due to a fire (and I couldn't go inside) but it was overall a fun visit.

Very interesting new information about the end of the civil war. I had no idea Johnson and Sherman ended up being lifelong friends. The video is a must see to put this place in proper historic perspective. The grounds are small, so this is a quick tour.

My wife and I took a trip to the Bennett Place. We truly enjoyed ourselves with the history and the buildings. It made you feel like you're back in time. Also grabbed a few pictures of the beautiful area around Bennett Place. If you like history you should check this place out !

Don't miss an amazing opportunity to see history up close and personal.
A furnished civil war era homestead to tour through, along with a museum full of artifacts.
Easy handicap access, well-maintained restrooms, a modest picnic area, and a quaint gift shop all add to the quality of the experience here.

Adults, if you haven't checked this place out, you should. It doesn't take very long and is definitely worth the time. It does a good job at pointing out that there were more similarities than differences with the people that fought the war and, at least the presentation I saw, presents the content without any political spin. 

I went here with my daughter's school and enjoyed it and learned a bit. I remember going when I was about my daughter's age and it was interesting seeing it with adult eyes. I remember virtually nothing about my first trip, a shock to no one, but this trip I picked up some Civil War facts that I didn't know.

The demonstration and talk by the Civil War reenactment soldiers was especially good. They gave a quite interesting and detailed,  but still kid friendly, account of what life might have been like for civil war soldiers. It was interesting to hear details about the uniform and gear they carried, their uses, and how they changed throughout the war.
Love it here! Hope to go back and walk the grounds when it's not wet underfoot. Museum very thorough and well done!

Great information on the heyday of the tobacco industry and it's effect on the economy and society of North Carolina and the United States. The exhibits are a bit dated but the information is comprehensive.
I love this place. Quiet. Love to take my little dog for walks. A reminder of simpler times.

My wife and I found this to be a very well presented history of the Duke family and of the tobacco industry in North Carolina.  We went on a Tuesday afternoon and received a private tour of the barns and house.  The docent, Bobby was very  knowledgeable, polite and interesting.  
Anyone who lives in NC or is just visiting should visit the site, get a tour, see the film and explore the museum.  We learned a great deal more than we anticipated.

Great educational location! Went for a haunted event and while it was simple it was a nice experience. The oil lanterns created a great spooky atmosphere while maintaining time period relevance. Would recommend for a local historic lesson.

Cash only place that has been amazing time and time again. It's a small menu but the egg rolls and lemon grass pork were out of this world. At first glance you might make some assumptions but the older woman who runs the front is nice and you can tell the food is homemade. I can't recommend this place enough.

Not great but not horrible. The traditional Vietnamese dishes lack certain essential ingredients. The spring roll had one piece of basil and the "pho" had no herbs with it. The vegetable platter only came with fried tofu. The menu didn't have any descriptions so this came as a surprise. I typically think vegetables would come in a vegetable platter.
Amazing ginger chicken. Great place for a quick bite where the plates are loaded with flavor. Their ginger chicken is also topped with fresh shredded ginger on top of the plate.
Excellent food and plenty of it. The person that took my order helpfully told me, without me asking, that an item did not have a vegetarian sauce base. That was great.
The Veggie plate on Wednesday is one of the best meals in Durham. Mello Yello served by the can!

This place was amazing 20 years ago and still is great. I've been hoping to get back to Chapel Hill and come back. Much of Franklin Street has changed since then but Cosmic is still in the same alleyway with the same basic layout and same general menu. The food is still a great value though the prices have crept up. The portions are plentiful and everything is delicious.

I decided to order the Giant Burrito. Unfortunately, I didnt realize that it weighed 15 lbs. However, I made a commitment to myself as well as the United States of America to finish whatever food is put in front of me. I finished that entire burrito.... it tasted absolutely amazing. 11/10. I did it. I finished the entire damn thing. MERICA BABY
Guacamole was decent. Atmosphere is non-existent. It's fine.
Wholesome burritos cheap and fast. Can't go wrong with the regular veggie burrito, be sure to ask for some green sauce if you like a little extra spice.
Affordable and delicious! Staff is phenomenally friendly. I can't even guess how many burritos I've had here since moving to the Triangle. A local gem!

Not bad not great.  I have never had anything here except desserts and coffee, but they do have lunch options.  Never been unhappy with anything but not blown away by any of it.  Fair pricing.  Quiet feel.
Great place. Staff was very cool too, they were trying to help us re-create a drink we had in Thailand. The result was even better than the Thai drink.  Would definitely come again.

A cozy little cafe on ninth street, would recommend to friends. Mellow atmosphere, and great food for a good price. I have yet to find a better Gelato! Perfect place to spend some quality time by yourself or with a loved one.
It was a good place to spend good time but it was totally closed in December 2017.
Little coffee shop with nice coffee, delicious desserts and a truly lovely atmosphere. It feels like a breath of fresh air after the mildly frenetic feel of the rest of 9th. A great workspace.

This is probably the best breakfast spot I've ever been to! Great theme and decor both inside and out. Staff were also super friendly and nice. The coffee drinks we got were great and the food was outstanding!!! I think it was worth the price. Any time we visit Durham, we'll be sure to come back.

Delicious. We saw it on our way to the gardens and decided to stop by after our visit. We decided to have the blueberry frappe with a couple of cupcakes and a chocolate cookie. Everything was wonderful and they also were very friendly. The wait was short and the outdoor seating very special.

After a lovely dinner with my husband at a different rest. for Valentine's,  we drove to Mad Hatter for dessert as we shared several lemon bars with coffee before we got married.  My husband got an Americano and I order a regular coffee.  The young lady stated they don't have regular coffee and we are close to closing and we don't want to waste it.  Mind you it was 8  and they close at 9.  What a way to end our Valentine's night.

Conveniently located across from Duke's East Campus and a couple of doors from Whole Foods Market. Prices are reasonable. Staff is pleasant, but, on the day we visited, not ultra-competent. They got our order wrong on several counts, then came by the table to say they were out of an item they had sold us and we needed to order something else. The french fries were good but the rest of the food was so-so. Not in a hurry to go back.
Light and open coffee shop with excellent entrees and baked goods. Easy to find. Parking is sometimes difficult between 8 and 9 and around 4 to 5. Friendly staff.

The food was absolutely delicious! One of the best Mexican restaurants I've ever eaten at. Huge servings and all around great service! If you're looking for a great Mexican restaurant please check them out. You'll be glad you did!

I don't care for this type of cuisine but I did find something that I liked and it was way above average.  The steak and shrimp were charred to perfection.  My wife did get burritos and chicken and she was also impressed.  Very good for the price.  I will go again.

Make sure you look at your bill when you get it.  They automatically add gratuity for parties of any size and then on top of that, on the receipt you sign (which isn't itemized) there is suggested gratuity.  Not only does this make it seem like you haven't tipped already, you'd be tipping based on an amount already increased by 15% automatically.  If you're not paying attention, you can very easily end up double tipping.  After finally realizing this on my most recent visit, I feel extremely duped by the other few times I've eaten here and most likely double tipped.

What makes it even worse is that they are not up front about this policy at all.  Usually if this is a policy there is signage and the wait staff is very up front about it.  The only I saw was posted on the men's room door.  So I guess unless you are a male that needs to use the bathroom and likes to read signs on the bathroom door, you're not supposed to know.  Shame on you Toreros.
Excellent! Huge cheese bowls, enough for the table. Great salsa. Awesome place for groups. Big TVs on the wall and huge bar area

Pretty good! If you live near the border, it won't knock your socks off, but you'll still like it. Otherwise, you'll be pleased. Prices are reasonable, and portions are large. Service was friendly and prompt. The decor is what I normally expect to see in a sit down Mexican restaurant in a non-border state.

Love this Restaurant. Very yummy food. Very quick service. I will definitely be returning. The price was well worth the money. If you’re looking for a night on the town and want to enjoy a seafood treat, I highly recommend this restaurant.

My girlfriend and I went for Triangle restaurant week. The staff was friendly and helpful. We both had the oyster rockefeller appetizer, which was fried lightly and very good. Our main dishes were the catch of the day and shrimp and grits, Both having grits in them. The grits on both dishes were in big clumps as if cold and reheated and no liquid in them. The flavors were good however. We hoped to have a good dessert to save the meal but they were out of the one we wanted, but they did take the price off for the lack of the dessert. So good service. Really wanted to like this place more, and would try again if not for the numerous other options in the area. Worth a try at least
Great food but the decor could use some sprucing up. Portions OK for me but might be small side for a more hardy appitite. Also desserts -2 of them - were good but very small for the price.
Food is good! It’s a cute little place! Enjoyed their calamari and steamed oysters.

Food and service was excellent. Portion size a tad small for the price... but I can live with that.
BUT.....

-1 star for the dingy appearance of the restaurant. In desperate need for a renovation.....

-1 star for the dessert size. $8.00 for an 1” slice of chocolate torte or a weak key lime dessert, also 1” slice for $7.50. Truly disappointed in that.  Such a tiny serving

There was 3 tables with people at 8pm on a Saturday. Every time I’ve passed the restaurant I thought it was crowded. The parking lot and street are always full. We had to park down the street. Seems everyone was at Vin Rouge and not Blu.

Really cool atmosphere, especially outside. A great place to go in nice weather. Order at the counter unless you sit at the small bar. We had the schnitzel which was very tender and perfectly crispy however it didn't fill us up for long. The beers were great and the bartender was helpful in explaining the beers and picking out some we would like.

We really enjoyed brunch at Guglhupf. We had eggs Benedict, eggs Arnold, and the omelet. All were wonderful. The meals came with a side order of fruit, which is greatly appreciated. 2 of us also each got a mocha latte, which was a real treat.  Beside the restaurant is a bakery with breads and desserts. We tried 3 of the desserts all of which were excellent. This is a very casual restaurant. You order at a counter, fetch your own utensils and water, and then go find a table and your order is brought to you.  It can get very noisy.  We had a bit of difficulty finding an open bussed table. Our food was delivered very promptly.  I would return!

Delicious German food and beautiful seating both inside and outside with speedy and friendly service. The bakery has many delicious pastries and German market items as well. 

One of my favorite spots in Raleigh/Durham! It has been here for decades and it isn't hard to see why.

I loved this place. I just came for breakfast but have to come back for lunch. The atmosphere is out of the Eastern European countryside and the breakfast dishes and coffee were amazing. I would've liked to see more options in the bakery, but still a nice selection. Be happy to come back another time.

Guglhupf has the best atmosphere inside and out of any restaurant in Durham and easily the best pastries. Delicious menu anytime of day. Perfect for a sunny summer brunch or a special indoor dinner. We love coming here.

Awesome food. I tried salmon and few more and it was fine and amazing. 
Ambience little dated but may be fine for business outings. 
All 4 stars are for food only. You need to work on speeding up service for drinks, especially when there are 3 waiters around you and taking orders. Looked like little chaos as had to ask for my drink twice.

Wonderful experience! The staff went out of their way to make the meal a birthday night to remember. Kristina was great! And I can't thank her enough. The mousse, the scallops, they were even better than she described. Easily the best scallops I have ever tasted. Dessert was delicious. Truly amazing all around!

Simply our favorite restaurant in the area.  Shane Ingram may not get the publicity of some of the other chefs in the area, but this has been consitently one of the finest restaurants in Durham for many years.  Set in a historic home in Durham, dining occurs in several rooms in the house.  There are typically 4 or 5 tables in each room,  The decor is upscale and generally intimate.  Our service has been been consistently good.  The manager Brandon has a good knowledge of the wines.  Shane varies the menu about every two months.  Keep an eye out for special events such as their tomato or lamb events.  We have rarely had a meal there that was not excellent.  Highly recommended.

Never a bad meal here.  Pricey but the food is great.  I'm hoping that owner/chef Shane does not stretch himself too thin with his other restaurant ventures.  This place is great food in a really nice setting.

This restaurant is very much overpriced for what you get. I ordered NY Strip steak served with gnochi. The gnochi was 2 inches square and 1/2 in thick with 2 small slices of NY Strip served over it with oxtail broth and a couple of greens--hardly enough to be called a meal-- for $30. It was tasty, but was more appetizer size. The piped in music was not appropriate for a fine dining venue. The rum cake I had for dessert was also about 2" square and about 1/2 in thick with 5 small pieces of pineapple for $9.50.

Disappointed in our first visit to NanaSteak. Food was very good, but the service ruined the experience. The wife and I visited for brunch and were sat very close to several other couples. There was literally no one in the restaurant and we were sat so close to people, we know their vacation plans. Seriously, massive place and I'm bumping elbows... sad. I also think we had 4 different servers over the 45 minutes we were there. One of which told another couple the sausage was not good and had a weird texture. I think the biggest complaint was the state of the dinning room. Thick, caked on dust everywhere, including the booth my wife was seated on. Hideous. We will not be returning.
Great food. Fast service. Ideal location
Good food great staff we had a party of eight so we had a little wait time
The steaks were delicious but think the sides are a bit overpriced.  The service was good. The cocktails were good but not spectacular.

The service was great. The location was great. The food was very underwhelming. I love other Nana restaurants, but this one’s food did not compare to the others. The steaks were... just ok. The Mac and cheese was dry with little flavor. We left “that was not that great”.
Incredible Pizza combos and excellent staff. Good place for a beer too. I go every Tues.

Friendly service staff. Love their #2 pizza for the crispy thin crust, sausage, pepperoni. They could put a little more extra toppings when requested. Otherwise the beer selection is very good. Kid friendly atmosphere. Outdoor seating.
Very good pizza. I have gotten take out from here a couple of times and it's always been ready on time. Service was excellent.
Very family friendly! Took my 2 year old here and he loved it! Didn't feel like he was bothering anyone or making to much commotion for the space. Yummy pizza!

Great food and reasonably priced. Three of us ordered from GrubHub and had it delivered to the hotel. We got it warm and within an hour. The 3 pasta dishes were very good. Mine was the best. I got chicken Alfredo with prosciutto and Parmesan. The only complaint was the carry out boxes were cardboard and folded. Cardboard and liquid don’t go together so when the delivery arrived, all the sauce was in the bottom of the plastic bag and none was on the noodles. I think it may have been slightly tipped during the delivery. Either way they need different containers for carry out. Other than that, delicious!
